thread.title: Monaco 3-1 Manchester City (6-6 agg) PLAYER RATINGS as Aleksandar Kolarov and Gael Clichy fail to fire
thread.title_full: Monaco 3-1 Manchester City (6-6 agg) PLAYER RATINGS as Aleksandar Kolarov and Gael Clichy fail to fire

author: John Cross
title: Monaco 3-1 Manchester City (6-6 agg) PLAYER RATINGS as Aleksandar Kolarov and Gael Clichy fail to fire
text:
Kylian Mbappe celebrates his opening goal for Monaco (Photo: REUTERS) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Leicester City are the only Premier League team left in the Champions League after Manchester City were knocked out by Monaco. 
Early first-half goals put City on the back foot and despite Leroy Sane's strike, a late Tiemoue Bakayoko goal eliminated City. 
City conceded within the first eight minutes of the game when hotshot striker Kylian Mbappe prodded home from close range. 
Fabinho then hit home to turn the tie around, meaning City had to score. 
That goal came as the game entered the final stretch, with Sane slamming home into the roof of the net. 
But Bakayoko ensured that the Ligue 1 leaders would go through when he hit home 12 minutes from time. 
Here is how we rated the players' performances... City were knocked out of the Champions League (Photo: Getty Images) Tiemoue Bakayoko's goal proved to be the difference (Photo: REUTERS) Pep Guardiola had a frustrating night on the sidelines (Photo: AFP/Getty Images) Manchester City 
Made good save when Mbappe went through, but it was a brief reprieve. 
Sagna 6 
Booked. Took out Silva with a brutal challenge, given hard night. 
Stones 6 
Had been getting much better, but this was a step backwards for him. Pep Guardiola speaks with John Stones (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) Fabinho celebrates scoring Monaco's second goal (Photo: REUTERS) 
Kolarov 5 
Horribly exposed, made to look a liability. City need to replace him asap. 
Clichy 5 
Used to be good as attacking threat, now even that has gone. Very poor. 
Fernandinho 6 
Given a thankless task of being the only defensive minded midfielder. 
Silva 7 
Wore the armband on his 50th Champions League game, better second half. 
De Bruyne 6 
Booked. Frustrating first half but got better. great pass in build up to the goal. Kevin De Bruyne in action with Benjamin Mendy (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) Leroy Sane celebrates his goal which gave City hope (Photo: AFP/Getty Images) 
Sterling 6 
Showed good energy and determination, his shot helped force City’s goal. 
Sane 7 
Scored and always looked City’s most likely attacking player. City’s best player. 
Aguero 6 
Could not take advantage of three big openings. Wasteful in attack. Monaco 
Subasic 6; Sidibe 7, Jemerson 6, Raggi 6, Mendy 8; Bakayoko 7, Fabinho 7, Lemar 7, Silva 8; Germain 7, Mbappe 8 MOTM. Kylian Mbappe scored the opening goal for Monaco (Photo: Getty Images) Monaco deserved to take the lead (Photo: AFP/Getty Images) City found themselves behind in the tie early on (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) Like us on Facebook
